metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8141 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the getZip64Data function in Info-ZIP UnZip 6.0 and earlier allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted zip file in the -t command argument to the unzip command.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8141` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

unzip - 6.0-9ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: unzip package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.0-9ubuntu1.1').
